<title level="1" right="Hazard 3" pfs="">[Drowning Pit](/Hazards.aspx?ID=489)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Complex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=30" />
<trait label="Mechanical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=105" />
<trait label="Trap" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=158" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 106 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Complexity** Complex

</column>

A trapdoor covers a 10-foot-square pit that’s 30 feet deep and has 5 feet of water at the bottom. Four water spouts in the walls connect to hidden water tanks. Each water spout extends out of a different wall, 6 inches from the top of the pit.

---

**Stealth**
+10 (trained); DC 22 (expert) to notice the water spouts once the pit opens

**Disable**
DC 18 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=50) (trained) to seal each water spout, DC 22 Thievery (trained) to open the trapdoor, or DC 22 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) to [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=2375) the trapdoor

<column gap="tiny">

**AC** 19, **Fort** +8, **Ref** +5

**Trapdoor Hardness**
15

**Trapdoor HP**
60 (BT 30); **Spout Hardness** 8; **Spout** HP 32 (BT 16)

**Immunities**
[critical hits](/Rules.aspx?ID=2190), [object immunities](/Rules.aspx?ID=2161), precision damage

</column>

**Pitfall** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature walks onto the trapdoor; **Effect** The triggering creature falls in and takes damage from the fall, reduced by 5 feet for falling into the water (typically 12 bludgeoning damage). A creature can [Grab an Edge](/Actions.aspx?ID=2313) to avoid falling. The trapdoor then slams shut, and the hazard rolls initiative.

---
**Routine**
(4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled water spout. On each of the trap’s actions, a spout pours water, increasing the depth of the water by 5 feet. Once the pit is full of water, the pit stops using actions, but creatures in the pit begin [drowning](/Rules.aspx?ID=2439).

---
**Reset**
